tip.text: Surreal. A real palace for your taking and to sink in. It's influence has just become enormous. Surely, the name says it all.
I'm not going to write anything! Huh, WHAT? What do you really want me to write about this devil here? Grrrr, okay okay. This molten lava cake has all the right to destroy my diet! Period!
Spice it up! Pakistani Restaurant and all the Pakistani cuisine in there. Well, expect it to be hot and yes, spicy! Fire truck must be on stand by here. Well...
With very many loyal followers on this open shisha haven, I am beginning to like this no frill hang out. Menu is so-so but my golly hookah WOW - this place is bustling when days turn nights! Be here!

location.address: Corniche Abu Dhabi near Chevrolet Showroom
formattedAddress: Corniche Abu Dhabi near Chevrolet Showroom

tip.text: First impression means everything. Replete with stunning interior features, this place is enchanting.
Your experience begins when you step in the hotel. A truly sophisticated lobby lounge! Well, high ceilings and display of soft lights - remarkable. Great to hang out, intimately.
When in this pit stop, you drink coffee! Their coffee selection and the way they do Italian brews just burst in your taste buds, not to mention the impeccable view of Abu Dhabi while sipping your cup
If you were born to shop for luxury and branded goods at an ultra posh setting, this is the place.  Galleria is taking shopping to a whole new dimension. Class, just classy.

formattedAddress: Abu Dhabi Global Market Square (Al Maryah Island)

tip.text: Pulse Corniche. Constant flow of light patterns illuminates the skyline at night. Heartbeats will make this lights dance. Only at Corniche Abu Dhabi. Beautiful.
A much talked about shisha haven is getting recognition as the place to be. The outdoor setting on their incredibly beautiful terrace, coupled with drinks and friends is PERFECT for a night away!
It means in Chinese 'beautiful river' and Li Jiang is moments of calm reflection for those who comes for great Chinese cuisine.
I am no golf or horse riding enthusiast but this place is jaw dropping when sunset hits the skyline & the night mellows. Not so great food but the place is A list!
Glam up your shisha night and head to this place.  Scenic view of The Ritz between waters, night breeze and beautiful people in lounges and nooks.  Drinks are tempting too.  Indulge!
Brunch.  Typical of any hotel to have.  Nice buffet until they moved us to another table in the midst of our dining.  They say they were preparing it for lunch.  So we left and will never come back!

formattedAddress: Beach Rotana, Al Zahiyah (Tourist Club Area)
location.address: Beach Rotana, Al Zahiyah (Tourist Club Area)

tip.text: Just 2 weeks old and I set foot on this place. Food was OK, typical asian dishes you see everywhere. My heart sank when management said they concentrate more on deliveries. No wonder why it was empty.

location.address: shop 1, Barsha Oasis Building, Behind Novotel Trio
formattedAddress: shop 1, Barsha Oasis Building, Behind Novotel Trio (10 B)

tip.text: Buffet lunch.  Its was nothing great, just your ordinary flair of food in chafing dishes.  Not expensive so it was ok.  Big meetings are done here so people really don't care about details of food.
Had a big steak here.  Twas ok, nothing great.  Value for money, well - it is inside a mall! Nothing to expect much. Great themed restaurant filled with classic movie stars.
Smoked Salmon Platter. Yup, salad! Recommended by yours truly.  Love. Love. Love. Good place for a quick business meet in the heart of Abu Dhabi.
Insalata De Mare, hmnn - why can't I forget you? You are divine.
LASAGNA *CAPLOCK!* A place of bliss for all pasta lovers.  The venue with a view by the water - just pure bliss.

Came here to my surprise that it is really an awesome cool place!  Space and modern architecture in the inside. For snacks I had their humungous clubhouse sandwich and I just loveet! Hidden gem in AD.

venue.name: Southern Sun Abu Dhabi (سوذرن صن أبوظبي)

tip.text: Black Angus Sirloin, yes - I was hungry when I visited this southern border style restobar and they didn't disappoint me.  I really love the look and feel of this place, best to hang out w/ beer buds!
Brunch here was rather empty, not so many was dining when I came.     Nothing to write about. Just brunch. They say the Seafood Buffet served every Thursday nights is bustling, so I must return.
A salad bar selection of homemade olive-oil infusions, while everything tasted perfectly.  This warm and friendly-feel place has a lot of emphasis on good steaks that you don't pay for a fortune.
Smoked Duck salad and Burrata, Herb Crusted Carpaccio, Australian Ribeye, Irish John Stone, Meerlust Merlot, Baked NY Cheesecake ... And a night you want to go back to. Food was GREAT! (CAPSLOCK)
Rooted in traditional preparation for that Italian classics, Abu Dhabi houses this prominent restaurant at Intercontinental Marina where dining is served to a T! The menu, view, & the delight in one!
Intimate. A commanding presence greets you, this is not just any steak house. It is sophisticated and a promise of a dining experience you will never forget. Steaks and wine meets, perfect!
Byblos Sur Mer, stunning restaurant with a wicked view and serving you the finest Lebanese cuisine - a history of traditional flair on your table!
This English pub at the Sheraton Abu Dhabi is charming its way to all beer lovers. With great service and it's good pub grubs, certainly welcoming!

location.address: Sheraton Abu Dhabi Hotel and Resort
formattedAddress: Sheraton Abu Dhabi Hotel and Resort (3rd Street)

tip.text: Tea has been the new black, and getting away from all the coffee mania - this place speaks the loudest for great healthy alternative drinks! Trending.
Scenic night view of the pool illuminated, perfect spot to hang out for quite, coffee or tea, and wind the night away.
Luxury and opulence, class at length, nothing like The Ritz.

contact.facebookName: The Ritz-Carlton Abu Dhabi, Grand Canal

venue.name: The Ritz-Carlton Abu Dhabi (الريتز-كارلتون أبو ظبي)

tip.text: SACCI OPENS TODAY September 30, 2014!  YOU. MUST. VISIT.

formattedAddress: The Westin Abu Dhabi Golf Resort & Spa
location.address: The Westin Abu Dhabi Golf Resort & Spa

contact.facebookName: The Westin Abu Dhabi Golf Resort and Spa

venue.name: Sacci Italian Restaurant The Westin Abu Dhabi

tip.text: Sacci's *Chef's Table* balances the demands of heritage & modernity. And this has created the restaurants traditionalist and those seeking something entirely new to be both amply catered for.

formattedAddress: The Westin Abu Dhabi Golf Resort & Spa
location.address: The Westin Abu Dhabi Golf Resort & Spa

contact.facebookName: The Westin Abu Dhabi Golf Resort and Spa

venue.name: Sacci Italian Restaurant The Westin Abu Dhabi

tip.text: Waste not, want not ethos means that every part of animals/plants is used. So diverse is the cuisine but to some it can be overwhelming- surprising, delicious or disgusting -but above all, different.

Apple pies and coffee - and pastas and sandwiches in a lovely combination in this Middle Eastern authentic mall setting. I have to say this place never disappoints and I bet you'll love it too. Yummm!
Patrons of this famous burger bar gets a simple, evenly formed, juicy grilled patty of grass fed beef served on a lightly toasted bun. Simple but very loud in taste, filling. I had C N Cheese for 32.
This sleepy cafe or cake nook inside RTA that even those working at RTA won't come near. I sat here for a meeting since no one was there (perfect spot) and ordered Burj Khalifa - ahhh, my mistake!
I just happened to be booked here so I dined.  Very few souls dining in their capacious dine area so it looks bare. Menu is decent, I had steaks since I was famished. Kinda good or was I just hungry?
A very cultured destination that is filled w indescribable beauty & it’s hard to say whether a single visit would truly be enough to truly experience all of it. This is what sets it apart from Dubai.

The amalgamation of international effect and a vigorous commitment to local heritage has created an interesting mix of new and old. AD culture is firmly rooted in Arabia's Islamic traditions- AMAZING!
Unique and beguiling, this has a cuisine of binaries. Its food is notoriously nutritious, and so it is. Had miso soup plus their combination of sushi and sashimi plate - I was in love.
Down below the basement of the hotel is this lively bar with mostly expats drinking their heart out jam to a live band. They have great hot pies with really thick & big fries that goes on every meal!
Sandwiches were good but not great - but the biggest turn off is that they serve their sandwiches and all other meals in styro lunch packs (????) That escaped my mind.  Why?
Over time, foreign influences have shaped Filipino food, with a blend of Chinese, Spanish, Mexican, American and Malay cuisines. They have great food here but the service really cannot be swallowed.

location.address: Beside Al Mariah Mall, Najda Street
formattedAddress: Beside Al Mariah Mall, Najda Street

tip.text: Blessed w abundance of seafood, tropical fruits & creative cooks, there’s more to Filipino food than the mind-boggling balut-duck embryo. This place has some delicious dishes of its own. Comfort food!

A small corner hang-out for all Filipino craze fave.  Famed for 'boodle fight', a military style of eating food all on top of the banana leaves with viands and rice ready to eat using your bare hands!

formattedAddress: P.O.144735 Tourist Club Area, Electra Street
location.address: P.O.144735 Tourist Club Area, Electra Street

tip.text: Unbelievably posh yet serene.  The architecture just amazingly translate all that gives you the Arabic feel.  With all comforts of this sleek & classy spot, roads lead here for good meals & hang-outs.

formattedAddress: Sheikh zayed Street (Al Salam Main Highway)

tip.text: Well, this is a chain with a difference.  Located with the closest view you can get of Ski Dubai - and still got the tgif respectable menu. Salmon is good,  and strawberry shakes too.

formattedAddress: Mall Of the Emirates (at Sheikh Zayed Rd.)

tip.text: I will never look at bfast the same way again ever! This one is UNMATCHED!  6 open kitchens - all beyond expectations and all for your taking!
No wonder no one leaves a tip here. Food is okay but not great.  Place is dingy and waiters doesn't know what's going on.  Unhappy place!

When it comes to having the best steaks, this place is not amiss. Had black angus tenderloin in this picturesque joint & a salad named The Wedge -this you must have! Try goat cheese baklava-ah heaven!
Place is jam packed by shisha seeking lovers. The lentil soup here is awesome. Dinner was chicken & beef fajita, it was dry as the desert & hard as rubber - an after thought on this beautiful place.
Charming shisha hot spot jam packed by hookah lovers at night.  Food is not that impressive but if you are just out to hang and looking for shisha overload,  be here.
Watermelon and Feta Salad.  I am in love.  Had an 8 course dinner here and everything orgasmic!  Indeed one of the best in Abu Dhabi!

Experience singers serenading while dining. This posh Italian restaurant is a revelation of class w 1st rate menu list. I had Insalata Caprese, Branzino Cileno affumicata al tavolo. Translate that! :)

formattedAddress: Grand Millennium Al Wahda (Hazza Bin Zayed Street)

tip.text: Follow the heavy wood staircase below 2 floors & there you find the open space, wide seating asylum & beautiful pub. Very manly British bar w wide screens & loud band. Place to unwind and get deaf! :)
Dynamite Shrimps is a must-be-seen on your table. This Asian themed restaurant is gaining high speed momentum as it is always filled to the brim.  Well, everyone knows good food when it tastes one!
I have been here so many times and have dwelled on their respectable list - all good, all so delicious.  But one thing is constant, and always, I have to have this Steak House Salad all the time!
Gigantic grilled tuna sandwich here (and good) but before I had this, I recited half of the menu and it wasn't available. And also, it took awhile for my order to arrive. A disoriented shisha place.
10 out of 10 for food presentation - this Japanese place deserves its mention. The ambiance is exquisite with a view, so dimly lit, music grooves and the food highly recommended by yours truly.

formattedAddress: Aloft Abu Dhabi Hotel (at Khaleej Alarabi St)

tip.text: Fire Grilled Beef Tenderloin - medium well.  Well, many speak about the molten choco cake but have they really tried the main star here? This one will really knock their socks off! Soft and juicy!!!
The only nice thing this about this place is this bouillabaisse soup.  The rest are all swimming in lards & waitresses that seems so unhappy with their jobs. Many like this hub but not my cup of tea.

For seafood lovers and prawn freaks, yes, this is the place to dive in.  I couldn't quite put words when I saw the platter as it was way too humongous. Really gratifying meals and very dangerous - LOL
The maki here are unbelievably so delectable. Choose any from the menu and get amazed on how this small bite sizes can be so full of taste! These maki rolls are art pieces and are oh - oh so good!

Beef Broccoli-no one gets wrong with it. And this counter diner inside Dubai Mall is nothing short of giving the best meals in the box!  Oh I love love love. Great food on the menu list. Will be back!
Almost seem quite hidden but never lost in translation. This gem of a restaurant is a goldmine for sushi, sashimi, bento's and anything Japanese. Love the food. Omedeto Gozaimasu Sumo!
Very theatrical open pâtisserie & the showmanship is just applaudable.  This very unique restaurant stands out when it comes to customer experience. The place is just divine, and the food - ahh holy!

formattedAddress: Ground Floor, Jumeira Tower (Sheikh Zayed Road)

tip.text: The concluding potation if one doesn't intend to doze off through life...after all, isn't it bittersweet and sweltering? Ahhh, coffee - the smell so intoxication for the lust of life. Live it!  iLike!
A day without coffee is like something without something. Because nothing makes sense before coffee! Wifi, great pastries, coffee and all other else in their menu list  -my extended office anytime.

contact.facebookName: Tim Hortons Cafe and Bake Shop

tip.text: I am so in love with this place. The low light ambiance adds so much character & with the excellent Thai dining experience, this abode is flawless. A glass of wine is tempting, and I indulged. Prime.
I had caesar salad and spaghetti bolognese here. Wanted meatballs in it and though it wasn't in the menu - they complied to my whim. I overloaded my pasta with parmesan cheese, and well, orgasmic!

location.address: Dubai Marina, Next to Hamptons International
formattedAddress: Dubai Marina, Next to Hamptons International

tip.text: An interesting fusion of Arabian architecture with Venetian theme,  unique and first of its kind in Abu Dhabi and with breathtaking view of the Sheikh Zayed Mosque. It is a must visit.  Beautiful.

formattedAddress: Bain Al Jessrein (Khaleej al Arabi St)

venue.name: The Souk at Qaryat al Beri سوق قرية البري

tip.text: Italian Restaurant famed for their authentic homemade pasta dishes. Live cooking counter and display of wine varieties from where else, Italy! Perfect venue for quite meals. Loveet! Delizioso!

formattedAddress: Dubai World Trade Center (World Trade Centre)

tip.text: Delivering the ultimate clubbing in Abu Dhabi, RUSH is the only nightlife built over a F1 racetrack. Saturday Big RNB night with some of your wacky girlfriends & free drinks till 1am! GO!
They offer both Thailand and Chinese grabs proving that both cuisine needn't be mutually exclusive- a rare exception for dining in this quite out of focus theme turned out to be an experience.
Mozzarella, salmon, shrimp and caviar. Yeah, all found on a pizza! Named Exotica, this pizza is the must have in the dine list. Caesar Salad and Penne Al Pollo too. Well, e' stata una buona cena!

Slowly savour great meals in such an unblemished setting. Had Rib Eye Steak served w green beans, steak fries & CafeDeParis butter. Desserts were divine, a pretty Tiramisu & Mango Mascapone CheeseCake

formattedAddress: Le Méridien Abu dhabi (Tourist club area)

tip.text: ZWZ is an all time favourite among the locals with great window seats for people watching or just fritter away time with their speciality wraps and brews and exceptionally cordial attentive staff.
Open air shisha nook very VERY popular amongst locals and non-locals like me. Cozy with wide lounge chairs and huge TV screens in a garden like setting. Must be best to hang here October to February.

formattedAddress: Corniche Rd (Near Al Hilal Bank Mall)

tip.text: Modern Arabian restaurant that is very elegant and contemporary. Not totally Arabic but it feels so Arabic.  It defines Arabian aesthetic to another level. Almaz was just amazing!
Moon gazing or on a starless night, soft cold breeze against your skin. A good night to unwind, and the perfect ambiance to let go. This is the place! The hype of this outrageous bar is all true!
Turning Lebanese! Great dinner selection here and outstanding service. One of the best Arabic restaurant by far in AD! The kababs here are from another planet and this shisha garden is just so ideal.

The view is simply magnificent covering 180 degrees. The food is of very high class with mix breeds of Asian and French cuisine that challenges tradition. This restaurant has the most amazing setting!

formattedAddress: Level 57 Sands SkyPark, Marina Bay Sands Hotel Tower 1 (10 Bayfront Ave.)
location.address: Level 57 Sands SkyPark, Marina Bay Sands Hotel Tower 1

tip.text: Quite spacious & has a good assortment of bagels and good coffee.  You could just sit back and relax, get a coffee and use the WiFi here and do whatever you need to do. It will make you feel at home.
Salads just went on another definition here! The ambiance & the food seems to synchronise and just mesmerise you. Absolutely the best anti pasti, & yes-salads!

formattedAddress: Rosewood Abu Dhabi (Abu Dhabi Global Market Square)

tip.text: Lebanese Arabic Restaurant with a view of dhow sailboats passing through and through. Very authentic feel of Arabia!
private sing-a-long lounge ---> advance audio system and a very cozy place to match it! call 5239488 for bookings  ^_^
A marriage of the perfect ambiance and impeccable set of menu - what is Italian without pasta? Well, they have the best in the house … or say - Abu Dhabi!
Dangerous treat and they call it Chocolate Devotion. This irresistible  devilish pleasure is a must have whilst viewing the seascape. Ultimate passing of time!
At the heart of this elegant and grand lobby, ice cold teas and mindless scrutiny of the exquisite symmetry of water and sky as your thrust. Very nice place!
My addiction for salad continuous.  Fatoush in this shisha haven is appetizing.  Crowded but worth it.
It wouldn't be called Pizzaro for nothing.  The pizza here is all too wicked!  Best pizzas by far!
I only need coffee on days ending with the letter 'y'.  Starbucks inside the mall - with fast wifi and fab people.

location.crossStreet: Al Salam Street, Tourist Club Area
formattedAddress: Abu Dhabi Mall (Al Salam Street, Tourist Club Area)

tip.text: Hotel lobbies, coffee, tea and pastries. This one has a selection that gives your sugar rush a  spinning. Ohhhh, cakes!
Was gunning for everything Arabic and the mixed grill with all others that goes with it was a blast!
The place was serene, nice to enjoy quite meals with a view of the Sheikh Zayed Mosque by night. And friends meet. We thought it was too large but we gobbled the pizza in no time.  It was that good!
Must be wondering what am I doing here when I don't drink alcohol.  Well,  friends & of course the caesar salad.

location.address: Sheraton Abu Dhabi Hotel & Resort P.O. Box 640
formattedAddress: Sheraton Abu Dhabi Hotel & Resort P.O. Box 640 (salam street)

tip.text: A small corner diner w affordable rates for good sandwiches & shakes. REALLY!
The interior is modern with comfortable seating in all red. Both the potato & tomato with basil soup were really great & huge in portion for the price.
Minimalism and inspiration from japanese heritage w long wooden benches. I had teriyaki salmon soba - TO DIE FOR!!!
It's a purple and white oasis with a museum at the 2nd floor. Hmnn, food Ok, not great :|
Starbucks is Starbucks!  What sets this to the A-List is it is at Souk Al Qaryat Al Beri. That alone says much more about this must-go-place a lot!
The best best best frozen margarita in Tacloban City!
